info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 5:44PM MDT until June 08 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Glacier County in north central Montana... Northwestern Pondera County in north central Montana... Western Teton County in north central Montana... Northwestern Lewis and Clark County in west central Montana... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 544 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has already fallen. Additional thunderstorms moving in across the area are expected to produce rainfall rates of between 0.75 to 1.5 inches in the next 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Debris flows in steep mountainous terrain are likely to occur. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Heart Butte, Pishkun Reservoir, Dupuyer and Nilan Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
